items.title: IFA 2025 gives us a look at the ambitious Master X Series robot lawn mower concept with a mechanical arm
items.summary:
This year’s IFA event in Berlin has already given us many new tech reveals, with a bunch of robotic lawn mowers showcased amongst them, but there’s one that is standing out amongst the crowd with its very unique concept design. Coming from MOVA’s sub-brand, NexLawn, we’ve been introduced to the Master X Series Concept, described as “the first robotic mower with a fully functional mechanical arm.” What’s more, this arm isn’t being planned to limit itself only to mowing-related jobs, with more versatility thanks to interchangeable attachments – including pet interactions too! Head below to learn more about this ambitious robot.

items.title: EcoFlow’s short-term member-only deals drop DELTA 2 Max 440W solar bundle with free bag to new $1,282 low (Reg. $3,276), more
items.summary:
Running parallel to its extended Labor Day Sale, EcoFlow is also having a Home Backup Sale through September 14 with up to 62% discounts, 5% and 7% bonus savings, and more. Among the lineup, we’re seeing shorter-term member-only pricing on four units lasting through September 7, with a standout being EcoFlow’s DELTA 2 Max Portable Power Station coming with two 220W solar panels and a waterproof protective bag for $1,281.55 shipped, after using the code 25EFDCAFF at checkout for an additional 5% off your order. This particular bundle would cost you $3,276 were it at full price, with the bag missing from this bundle at Amazon, where it’s currently priced for $1,299, and has only gone as low as $1,234 in the past. Considering the bag costs $79, this combined 61% markdown for the next few days not only saves you a total $1,994, but gives you the best new price we have tracked. Head below for more on this and the other short-term member-only deals.

more…

items.title: First deal on a new 25W MagSafe car charger now live ahead of iPhone 17 launch
items.summary:
UGREEN was one of the first brands to roll out new Qi2.2 25W wireless charging gear, and it’s already discounting several of its latest chargers ahead of next week’s iPhone 17 reveal. After kicking things off with a deal on its 25W Qi2.2 MagFlow power bank, UGREEN’s official storefront is now offering the new 25W wireless car charger for $29.99 with Prime shipping (a $6 delivery fee will apply otherwise). This is the first deal we’re tracking on this unit since its debut last month, making it a great time to cash in and snag one for your car and keep it ready for the upcoming iPhone 17. Today’s deal shaves $10 off its usual going rate, and it even comes with a 3.3-foot USB-C cable in the box. Head below for more details.

We are still tracking a particularly notable $400 price on the unlocked 2025 Motorola Razr Ultra smartphones right now. But that one, despite the seriously deep deal, is still going to fetch you nearly double the price of the standard 2025 Moto Razr flip phone, and we are now tracking every color at $100 off courtesy of the official site. This deal is also live over at Amazon on select colroways.

For those looking to trade-up for the new model, or just pre-order one when everything goes live (likely next week), the ongoing slate of discounts on iPhone 15 and 16 are much less exciting, but for those looking for a deal there is as much as $730 in savings live right now courtesy of Amazon.

items.title: Enjoy smooth commutes and space-saving functionality on Heybike’s Horizon full suspension folding e-bike at $1,399 ($600 off)
items.summary:
As part of Heybike’s ongoing End of Summer Sale, which is offering up to $649 savings on its e-bike lineup alongside the usual free gear bundles, we wanted to shine a spotlight on the brand’s Horizon Full Suspension Folding e-bike that is down at $1,399 shipped while the event lasts and comes with a free front and rear cargo basket bundle. This model usually fetches $1,999 outside of sales, which we’ve mostly seen brought down to $1,499 over 2025, with more recent drops to $1,399 and a one-time fall further to the $1,299 low that appeared during the brand’s anniversary sale back at the end of May. Aside from that one-time low, you’re otherwise looking at the best price we have tracked, which saves you $600 on one of the brand’s more premium space-saving commuting solutions.

Anker’s IFA showing this year has been rather noteworthy, from AI-powered voice recorders, super new higher-power portable battery solutions, and its new 25W MagSafe charging stand with an onboard display, but it’s new MagGo Prime Wireless Car Charger seems to be slipping under the radar a bit. Featuring 25W of juice, and among the first MagSafe car charger to do so, it is now confirmed for an upcoming release and is eligible for the early-bird discounts we featured this morning.

It’s now matching the lowest price we first saw back in April, but today’s deal delivers better value thanks to the included 100W cable that typically goes for $15. Head below for more details.

items.title: Jackery weekend flash sale offers up to $1,200 savings on HomePower 3000 station and bundle at new lows starting from $1,499
items.summary:
Jackery’s Disaster Preparedness Sale running through September 16 is seeing up to 50% discounts across its power station lineup, complete with automatic 5% and 7% extra savings on orders over $1,300, as well as some free gifts accompanying the largest Explorer 5000 Plus series units. A standout, though, is the flash offer lasting only through the weekend on the latest HomePower 3000 Portable Power Station at $1,499 shipped, which comes in a little under Amazon by $4. Since its release back in May, we’ve seen it brought down from its full $2,499 price tag to land between $1,899 and $1,699 during sales, with Amazon seeing it drop to $1,599 for the first time today (while the on-page coupon there takes things lower) and the brand’s direct site taking things under $1,500 for the first time while these flash savings last, giving you $1,000 in savings at the best new price we have tracked. The bundle on this station and two 200W solar panels is also at a new low of $1,799 shipped, landing $100 under the previous low and $5 under Amazon’s current pricing.

items.title: Sony just jacked the price up on PS5, but you can land one today at up to $210 off (Refurb, Amazon warranty)
items.summary:
As you likely know by now, Sony has officially increased the price on all PlayStation 5 consoles here in the U.S. That puts the PS5 at $550, the PS5 Digital Edition at $500, and the PS5 Pro at $750…ugh. If you are looking to land a new machine right now, and would prefer to side-step the new jacked up pricing, Woot is offering a series of refurbished offers on the latest PS5 Slim Disc and Digital models right starting at $310 Prime shipped. Details below.

items.title: Lenovo’s new Legion Go 2 gaming handheld with Switch-like detachable controllers, built-in kickstand, more, now up for pre-order
items.summary:
After first showing up at CES in January and making its way through multiple leaks, Lenovo’s Legion Go 2 PC gaming handheld is now officially up for pre-order. Lenovo is offering two configurations of Legion Go 2 – one powered by the AMD Ryzen Z2 for $1,099.99 and another with the beefier Z2 Extreme at $1,349.99 shipped. You can pre-order the handhelds from Best Buy now and be among the first to get your hands on them when they officially hit the shelves next month. This new model brings several upgrades over the original Legion Go while retaining many of the features that made the original one popular, like detachable controllers, a built-in kickstand, and more. Head below for more details, along with a closer look at the handheld and its specifications.

more…
